Almost heaven West Virginia Blue Ridge Mountains Shenandoah River Life is old there Older than the trees Younger than the mountains Growing like a breezeCountry roads, take me home To the place I belongWest Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads All my memories Gather 'round her Miner's lady Stranger to blue water Dark and dusty Painted on the sky Misty taste of moonshine Teardrop in my eye Country roads, take me home To the place I belong West Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads I hear her voice in the morning hour, she calls me The radio reminds me of my home far away Driving down the road, I get a feeling That I should have been home yesterday Yesterday Almost heaven West Virginia Blue Ridge Mountains Shenandoah River Life is old there Older than the reminds me of my home far away Driving down the road, I get a feeling That I should have been home yesterday Yesterday Almost heaven West Virginia Blue Ridge Mountains Shenandoah River Life is old the place I belong West Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads I hear her voice in the morning hour, she calls me The radio reminds me of my home far away Driving down the road, I get a feeling That I should have been home yesterday Yesterday Almost heaven West Virginia Blue Ridge Mountains Shenandoah River Life is old there Older than the trees Younger than the mountains Growing like a breezeCountry roads, take me home To the place I belongWest Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads All my memories Gather 'round her Miner's lady Stranger to blue water DAlmost Stranger to blue water Dark and dusty Painted on the sky Misty taste of moonshine Teardrop in my eye Country roads, take me home To the place I belong West Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads I hear her voice in the morning hour, she calls me The radio reminds me of my home far away Driving down the road, I get a feeling That I should have been home yesterday Yesterday Almost Driving down the road, I get a feeling That I should have been home yesterday Yesterday Almost heaven West Virginia Blue Ridge Mountains Shenandoah River Life is old there Older than the trees Younger than the mountains Growing like a breezeCountry roads, take me home To the place I belongWest Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads All my memories Gather 'round her Miner's lady home yesterday Yesterday Almost heaven West Virginia Blue Ridge Mountains Shenandoah River Life is old there Older than the trees Younger than the mountains Growing like a breezeCountry roads, take me Country roads, take me home To the place I belong West Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads I hear her voice in the morning hour, she calls me The radio reminds me of my home far away Driving down the road, I get a feeling That I should have been home yesterday Yesterday Almost heaven West Virginia Blue Ridge Mountains Shenandoah River Life is old there Older than the trees Younger Gather 'round her Miner's lady Stranger to blue water Dark and dusty Painted on the sky Misty taste of moonshine Teardrop in my eye Country roads, take me home To the place I belong West Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads I hear her voice in the morning hour, she calls me The radio reminds me of my home far away Driving down the road, I get a feeling That I should have been feeling That I should have been home yesterday Yesterday Almost heaven West Virginia Blue Ridge Mountains Shenandoah River Life is old there Older than the trees Younger than the mountains Growing like a breezeCountry roads, take me home To the place I belongWest Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads All my memories Gather 'round her Miner's lady Stranger to blue water DAlmost country roads I hear her voice in the morning hour, she calls me The radio reminds me of my home far away Driving down the road, I get a feeling That I should have been home yesterday Yesterday Almost of moonshine Teardrop in my eye Country roads, take me home To the place I belong West Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads I hear her voice in the morning hour, she calls me The radio reminds me of my home far away Driving down the road, I get a feeling That I should have been home yesterday Yesterday Almost heaven West Virginia Blue Ridge Mountains Shenandoah River Life is old home, country roads All my memories Gather 'round her Miner's lady Stranger to blue water Dark and dusty Painted on the sky Misty taste of moonshine Teardrop in my eye Country roads, take me home To the place I belong West Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads I hear her voice in the morning hour, she calls me The radio reminds me of my home far away Driving down the road, I get a Younger than the mountains Growing like a breezeCountry roads, take me home To the place I belongWest Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads All my memories Gather 'round her Miner's lady Stranger to blue water Dark and dusty Painted on the sky Misty taste of moonshine Teardrop in my eye Country roads, take me home To the place I belong West Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads I hear her voice in the morning hour, she calls me The radio reminds me of my home far away Driving down the road, I get a feeling That I should have been home yesterday Yesterday Almost Stranger to blue water DAlmost heaven West Virginia Blue Ridge Mountains Shenandoah River Life is old there Older than the trees Younger than the mountains Growing like a breezeCountry roads, take me of moonshine Teardrop in my eye Country roads, take me home To the place I belong West Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads I hear her voice in the morning hour, she calls me The radio home To the place I belongWest Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads All my memories Gather 'round her Miner's lady Stranger to blue water DAlmost heaven West Virginia Blue Ridge Driving down the road, I get a feeling That I should have been home yesterday Yesterday Almost heaven West Virginia Blue Ridge Mountains Shenandoah River Life is old there Older than the trees Younger than the mountains Growing like a breezeCountry roads, take me home To the place I belongWest Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads All my memories Gather 'round her Miner's lady mountain mama Take me home, country roads I hear her voice in the morning hour, she calls me The radio reminds me of my home far away Driving down the road, I get a feeling That I should have been Painted on the sky Misty taste of moonshine Teardrop in my eye Country roads, take me home To the place I belong West Virginia, mountain mama Take me home, country roads I hear her voice in the morning hour, she calls me The radio reminds me of my home far away Driving down the road, I get a feeling That I should have been home yesterday Yesterday Almost heaven West Virginia Blue Ridge
